replies.commentBody: Then we get Ryan.  The benefit may be that his overfull plate would prevent his ongoing attacks on old and sick people.

comments.commentBody:
Our democracy is at stake.

All patriotic citizens regardless of political party should insist that Congress appoint an independent committee to investigate the Trump election Russian connection. If the independent committee proves treason, impeach Trump and Pence since both benefited from these treasonous acts and void and rerun the election with a new cast of Republican and Democratic characters.

Prosecute Trump and all involved in Federal Court and sentence those convicted to life in prison or death. We need to act with strength and decisiveness. The whole World is watching.

Trump himself called for Russia to spy on the United States, and they obligated. There was no consequences except now Trump owes Putin a big favor and potentially can blackmail Trump if the Russians hold evidence of collusion with a foreign power in meddling in the election. Those sanctions for Ukraine should be lifted soon, and expect a diversion to distract the hoi polloi concurrently.

replies.commentBody: And then we'll be stuck with Pence who probably won't start WWIII -- so at least we'll be able to stop worrying about that -- but a Pence presidency is still a very grim and frightening prospect.

comments.commentBody:
This is why it is extremely imperative that the Democrats at least win the Senate in 2018. Then Congress will finally fulfill its constitutional duties of powerful oversight over a President whose taint of treasonous behavior becomes ever more apparent to the American public.

Yes, Trump's supporters are so soaked and marinated in the conservative media echo-chamber that they will not believe most of the findings of fact that will come out of those investigations (or even findings from GOP investigations before 2018). In fact, I wouldn't be surprised to find out that a good chunk of that conservative media echo-chamber is indirectly subsidized by the Kremlin through a complex morass of shell companies and fronts. (Now that would be a great new line of inquiry and investigation that the NY Times can take up.)

But I would guess that the hardcore Trump supporters number 25% to 30% of the voting electorate. And that a few could be peeled off since they, hopefully, believe in the sanctity of the American Republic and its constitutional norms. That would leave 22% to 27%.

I just learned today that at the peak of the Watergate crisis at the beginning of 1974, Nixon had a "floor" of support at 22%, staying in the 20s throughout the year. And Congress moved swiftly to begin impeachment proceedings.

As more information trickles out, Trump's support will continue to erode. I have faith that 75% to 80% of Americans will support impeachment once hard evidence starts coming out.

There is no conceivable, legitimate excuse for Republicans to continue blocking a real, meaningful, independent investigation into ties between the Trump campaign and Russia.

If there is nothing to find, why are they all so scared to look?

Unless and until Congress has the courage and patriotism to appoint an independent Special Prosecutor to get the facts out into the public domain, the White House will stonewall any effort to investigate this matter by Congressional Committee(s), and try to turn it into a partisan standoff.

At best, we may be looking at incredibly poor judgement. At worst, we are looking at treason.

replies.commentBody: how about installing Hillary Rodham Clinton, the REAL president

comments.commentBody:
Tax returns now!

And/or

Impeach and Replace.

Clearly there is reason to investigate. Sadly the Republicans have charged the intelligence committees -- which meet in closed door sessions. They can classify any findings and successfully bury anything incriminating. In fact. both the House and the Senate chairs have already discounted the evidence.

The public worries about espionage and treason. Were the Trump campaign and transition teams working with the Russians to throw the election?

Republicans in Congress have no credibility. Let's get to the bottom of this now!

replies.commentBody: This is what should have been done in the first place.

comments.commentBody: Independent Special Counsel with full subpoena powers.

replies.commentBody: Chaffetz can go with him since they are two slugs in a pond.

comments.commentBody: The efforts of the White House to kill this story needs to be investigated. If Nunes is lying to the press & knows there were in fact meetings with Trump associates Nunes needs to step down, not only from his committee leadership, but he needs to resign entirely.

NYT-- please keep up this pressure and continue this level of reporting to the American people. Tomorrow is my Dad's birthday, he would have turned 90 had he not died 12 years ago. A WW2 vet, proud taxpayer/citizen, successful businessman and former republican--Dad would be astonished and heartbroken to learn the depths to which the GOP has sunk.  For surely some of this mess rests with them-- for being a destructive force during the Obama presidency; for  gerrymandering and attempting to upend the rights of voters; for allowing such a deplorable and dangerous man to rise to the top of their ticket; for playing footsies with the FBI during a fraught election campaign season; and for not expressing the appropriate outrage over the subterfuge surrounding this illegitimate election. The only appropriate question for this band of unpatriotic elected officials is: "have you no shame?"

replies.commentBody: @Richard: You're wrong about that.  As much as it would gall me to have Pence sitting in the Oval Office I'd rather him than a treasonous chief executive, whether it be Trump, Obama or anyone else.  For my part integrity and human decency rate more highly than anything else, and even if The Donald's connections to Russia just happen to be coincidental (and this is looking to less likely with each passing day) I consider him to be the most dishonorable person ever to occupy the People's House.  Pence's politics offend me but I wouldn't fear for the survival of the nation to the extent that I do now.

This smells dirtier than Nixon and Watergate. If trump is so clean release his emails to and from the Russians, Putin, Putins stooges and Russian banks and those of trumps cabinet members, campaign committee, family and advisors. And release his tax returns. If he is clean we can all move on. Clean guys don't obstruct an investigation. Trump is going down, he's dirty.

Steve:

It's so easy to be ideologically self-interested, even naive. Trump could do all the things you demand, that he's not required to do, and liberals simply will accuse of him of OTHER things without proof, in this no-holds-barred and desperate attempt to keep him from enacting his agenda.

Trump can take the advice I gave in my comment, but it's more likely that he's gong to conclude that WHATEVER investigations are mounted, simply exploding charges will only bring on more unfounded accusations -- so why bother with this one?

But if he WERE to take my advice, and a commission were named and conducted a bipartisan investigation that exploded these innuendos as just that, then I wouldn't be wiling to "just move on", which simply suits YOUR ideological needs and opens the way for MORE obstructionism: I'd want to see the people who concocted THIS behind bars.

comments.commentBody:
“Concern” for the legitimacy of our elections is one interpretation of the motives of those who “seeded” intelligence agencies with what even this news piece can’t present the slightest evidence as skullduggery on Trump’s part. Another interpretation is that Obama operatives believed that the success of Trump’s agenda if he were elected would be so damaging to what THEY regard as American interests that they felt justified in doing anything they could to sabotage it, even by ideologically self-interested innuendo with no factual basis.

I suspect that Trump won’t tolerate an ideological fishing expedition, but serious allegations without proof have been made. I now favor not an independent prosecutor because after the Bill Clinton debacle NO such prosecutor likely ever will be named again, but a bipartisan commission to act within strict investigative and time boundaries to seek clarity on these alleged “contacts” and their material content.

However, if it turned out after such an investigation that the “seeds” were without material basis in fact, that Trump’s people did nothing illegal or even censorable with the Russians than simply engage in a normal process as they did with the representatives of dozens of other countries, then I’d actively agitate for the indictment, trial and punishment if convicted of those who did the “seeding” and who have raised serious questions by innuendo of the probity of this government. Regardless of WHO the “seeders” were.

The evidence just continues to mount. Trump lies, and then lies about his lies. There is no reason to believe anything he says. I do not understand the why so many people put their faith in him. I only hope that some people in the government still possess integrity to investigate this matter, to bring it to the public, and to punish treason where it is proven. Nationalist? Not.

Once again we can see Obama's reticence to act even in the face of clear evidence of Russian collusion with Trump election team members. Obama agonized over the decision making and failed to either call out Trump or the Russians. The failure to call out either are egregious errors in judgement. Now we have paid the price for Obama's indecisiveness and fear of risk taking. Mr. Trump is President of the United States. Mr. Sanders was sidelined, indeed shoved aside by the Clinton machine while Hillary told us how qualified she was for the presidency. We were railroaded by Clinton, Trump and the Russians.
Of course, Mr. Trump is fearful of having his election declared invalid and illegitimate. The problem is its true. Trump will block every effort at investigation of the real events. Mr. Trump lacks honesty and integrity. Mr. Obama lacked the ability to face reality and act.
Hopefully the FBI and the Justice Department will prevail in their investigations. Maybe we can end the Trump nightmare and have a new election before September. Does anyone believe that the Republicans can offer an honest assessment and investigation of Donald Trump? I don't.

replies.commentBody: All farce - It's not voter suppression when they're felons or non-citizens.

I completely agree with you. The low voter turnout for both the US election and the Brexit referendum was shocking to me. How can anyone claim to have a mandate to lead (let alone exit the EU) when barely half of the eligible population actually voted? Such a high degree of voter apathy - especially among young people - is shocking when the stakes are so high.

My country (Australia) has compulsory voting, with elections always held on a weekend. It takes all of 5 minutes to vote and the event is often accompanied by charity barbeques (or 'sausage sizzles') held outside the polling place, which is usually a local school. It lends a certain festive atmosphere to proceedings.

While it is possible to get an exemption for voting (e.g. based on religious conviction), and it is easy to inform the electoral commission if you are unwell, overseas etc. - it has become ingrained in [most] Australians that voting is an obligation as well as a right. More importantly, if you don't vote, you have no right to complain about the outcome.

Hearing about deliberate voter suppression in the US, the closing of polling stations, and people having to queue for hours (on a workday!) is incomprehensible to me.

comments.commentBody: Russian interference in our election is obviously very concerning. But I wish we were equally alarmed by the voter suppression routinely happening across the country that disproportionately impacts people of color and our poorest citizens. Many of our allies have elections on the weekend or a public holiday, childcare on election day, automatic registration from the age of 18, or even compulsory voting. Why are we so far behind? As Obama said, it goes back to the legacy of Jim Crow.

This gets me really really worried. If so many well-informed and competent professionals were worried about this evidence disappearing, they must have considered it significant and important. I'm sure a push will be made to just label them as "partisan", but this seems highly unlikely. They are the experts in their fields and they were apparently concerned.

replies.commentBody: To be precise, 'spread' is loaded with negative connotation. But if the outgoing folks want to ensure there is no coverup, then 'preserve' the records so there is no sweeping under the rug. Sunlight is the best disinfectant

comments.commentBody: 'Spread' is not a neutral word. Maybe 'preserve' is a better one.

replies.commentBody: They are big spenders when it comes to attacking their enemy, but have the "move on - there's nothing to see here" attitude when it comes to one of their own.  Someday everyone of them who backed Trump and stood in the way of justice will pay for it dearly.
Turned up plenty. You were blind, like Trump supporters are now.
Please show us the evidence Trump is a traitor and Russian stooge? You sound like conservatives when they were claiming Obama was a closet Muslim ready to betray America. More obtuse partisanship.

comments.commentBody: Bengazi investigation of Hillary for years and millions turns up nothing, but Republicans are doing all they can to shut down investigation into Trump's treason.

As a former intel analyst specializing in the USSR/Russia, I think this is a wise move by the intelligence community. Trump corrupts everything he controls, and it is inevitable that he will work behind the scenes to discredit, obfuscate, and erase the evidence of his campaign's collusion with Russian officials to harm Clinton in the 2016 campaign. I'm certain that he will never disclose his tax returns because they contain damning, disqualifying evidence of his corruption, probably concerning financial ties to Russian oligarchs who bailed out his failing businesses. If his tax returns somehow do become public, I predict Trump will plead ignorance and blame his accountant and even his sons -- anything in order to avoid responsibility and accountability for his own actions. We have just seen an example of this when Trump said "the generals" had "lost" the Special Forces soldier who died in the recent raid in Yemen. Honest Don is a slippery one -- wear gloves and use a forked stick when trying to pin him down.
The information they were spreading was obtained from the Russians

They should start with revealing those pockets of information as soon as a special prosecutor is identified.

Even out of office, Obama remains the epitome of circumspection and class.
Amazing that people actually believe Obama was rushing to spread unproven Russian collusion stories to everyone in government because he was such a patriot. So obtuse.

comments.commentBody:
Thank you, President Obama! By leaving these damaging breadcrumbs" as a signpost, you have fulfilled one of your signature duties: "to preserve, protect and defend...the United States."

Apparently, your successor and his aides care(d) little for America in spite of his monotonous campaign promises to "make America great again." Your greatness, Mr. President, casts the puny president who succeeded you in the most treasonous light imaginable.
